page.title: 03LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: Evidence of Neolithic occupation in the barrows,south of Broadmayne.3 destroyed by gravel digging at Warmwell.Beaker burial of early Bronze Age & Iron Age grain pits found when building Broadmead,Broadmayne.Stone Circle at Poxwell may have been Druidical Temple.Manors:Warmwell- early 17thC.Jacobean Y-plan house. Poxwell-also early 17thC.but less ambitious.Fragmentary remains of home of Knights Hospitallers at Friarmayne. Nearby deserted medieval village destroyed by ploughing,1963.More recently,during Second World War, Broadmayne was American Army base. Road half mile south of village was widened & straightened to take men & equipment to Weymouth for the Normandy invasion in 1944.Former village schools at Warmwell & Poxwell converted to private homes in 1950's
